data.title: Works well
data.body: Very cute little microwave. Space saver. I did notice that I have to cook a little longer then I did with my large microwave. But for the price, I will deal with the extra minute or two.

data.title: The cost was reasonable.
data.body: It's smaller than the old one and takes up less counter space. It works good and is easy to operate.

data.title: simplistic and small footprint
data.body:
I got it on a special deal of the day only paying about $84 for it so I can't complain about the price. It works fine but at 700W I always have to add time for cooking directions as most frozen dishes, or other items are based on using a 1200W Microwave. I don't have to add a lot of time, but say if it says 4 minutes, I leave it in for five etc. It does require more space than you'd think, so be sure you check the specs for safety, one side they ask for a 4 feet clearance, not sure why, I gave it two and it seems to work without any issues. You'll also have to remember NOT to put things on top of it (you should have about a 10" clearance above it, and at least 3 to 4" behind it. That worked okay on my counter. I have a very limited income so when my old Sylvania died (after giving me some 23 or so good years), another 700W, I had to find an inexpensive replacement and this was it.

There is something that I find annoying. When I want to set it to a certain time, I'm so accustomed to just pressing 150 for 1 minute 50 seconds... but if you try that with this machine, as soon as you hit the one, it will begin a one minute timing no more no less, and you'll have to stop it, and go the longer way. You must push the timer button up top first, when four 0's appear, THEN you can enter you 150, or 430, or whatever not an even minute timing you wish.

It has a nice glass revolving tray inside. I use covers for all of my dishes because microwaved items give off a lot of water vapor since it is the water molecules it stimulates. This is what eventually killed my old machine. I didn't realize all that moisture was just sitting on top of the inside of my microwave and eventually it rusted. (Yes, of course I regularly cleaned my microwave; but since it rarely got dirty or showed spillage, there might be a week or more before I'd wipe it down. Now I know that by having fairly inexpensive plastic covers (1 large and one small) they will trap most of the steam on them, and a quick wipe across the top of the inside, should keep it from eating away at the metal surface. Anyway, it's a good buy for the price, it works well. It doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the MUCH higher priced microwaves--but it does do the job.

data.title: Good - my original bad review was wrong
data.body:
Bought this about 2 years ago. It started sparking badly and scared the heck out of me. Since then I’ve learned there are three things that can cause sparking, one of which is user fixable. That is the waveguide. It’s the silvery paper-like panel you can see inside when you open the door and look to the right. Mine was scorched. That caused the sparking. I took it off to try cleaning it, didn’t see the button fastening and tore the heck out of it. Gave up and let the microwave sit there.

Today I accidentally heated some food in it: no sparking. So. I ordered a “microwave waveguide” here on Amazon. When it arrives I will install it, and resume using my micro happily again.

data.title: Great microwave
data.body: Our microwave broke and I didn’t want to spend a ton of money on a new one. This one works great. Looks nice and works perfectly!

data.title: Small package nice features
data.body: We bought this unit to replace one that lasted about 15 years. We had a space requirement, it had to fit on a shelf that is 12 inches deep. As we began looking for a replacement we found that most of the small units available were too deep to fit on our shelf. This was one of the few we found. We also liked the control features as they were much like the ones on the old unit that died. Over the years I have seen many micro waves ovens whose control features were not intuitive and as such hard to understand and use. The new unit was well packaged and very nice looking. We are happy with our choice.

data.title: Tinier than the specs
data.body: I was replacing another small microwave and I expected a larger microwave according to the dimensions given in the picture. However, when I got it it looked almost like a toy with how small it was, even if it was just 1 or 2" smaller in multiple dimensions. The true outer dimensions are 16" wide and 9" tall by ~12" deep. It's tiny looking and it doesn't fit most things other than bowls and mugs. It does work though and gets water hot quickly. The door is not opened by a button so you have to pull it open by force. The problem is, the feet are plastic and not non-slip, so the entire microwave slides around with the slightest pull. I had to put non-slip matting under it for it to stay relatively in place. Not the most conveniently made microwave nor true to size, but it does work. I will probably return this in a few days if it keeps on sliding around.

data.title: Small but great microwave
data.body: quiet, a lot of preprogrammed buttons, large enough for a plate, bowl, etc.

data.title: Decent small microwave
data.body: The good is that it fits on the counter and doesn’t take up a lot of space. It’s easy to use and looks nice. The bad is that it takes forever to heat things up, so it’s pretty low power.

data.title: So far, so good
data.body:
Whilst looking for a replacement microwave for the 37 year old GE Spacemaker II (back then they knew how to build things so they'd last), reading the one-star reviews on ALL of them is enough to give you the shivers, one ultimately has to decide on something. Or forego having a microwave altogether. After several days of being without: enduring mediocre coffee, hot if fresh from a brewed pot, but meh otherwise, waiting forever for things to thaw, and so forth, we decided to roll the proverbial dice and get one.

Which led us to this one. We wanted something with a bit more power than the venerable GE, but as we mainly use the microwave for reheating and defrosting, not cooking, we didn't need one that would zap something with too much energy. Why use a battleaxe when a stiletto will do? Given how many of these things are now all-in-one appliances with air fryers, grills, and who knows what all else anymore, we took to the KISS principle, thinking that this is a microwave oven, that's all it needs to do. Further, after reading about key panels that are so dim you need a flashlight to read them, this unit with a more minimal set of controls was also appealing.

Pros:

Small space - the GE fits in a shelf space cut out to fit around our cabinets, but do you think GE would still have one that could be put into the same space now? "Beautiful dreamer, wake unto me..." Not happening. So since we don't want a hole in the cabinet space, the old one makes a great place to store our cat bowls and similar items. There is still function after death. So this Comfee claims some of the counter space, but not too much.

Nice interface - I did have to read the manual to find why pressing the kitchen timer button wasn't microwaving, it really is only a timer, the actual selection of time is a two-step process - select power level, then time by turning the dial.

Door with a handle. I was considering some with a "push the button" to open the door, but got to thinking that it is a spring in there to release the door, given the quality these days, they might not use a spring that will take a lot of repeated use.

Instant 30 seconds with tap of start button. Great for quick reheat. Can press multiple times if needed.

Tray brings item back to original position. When heating coffee, for example, you don't want to have to reach around the hot mug to get to the handle. This puts the handle back in front of you for much easier removal.

Packed well and arrived safely - good job on the packing and shipping.

Things I wish it would do:

Well, you can't have everything, I realize, but it would be nice if you could set the Eco mode which saves power when not using the microwave by turning off the display to be the default mode, rather than having to re-initiate it each time. Beeps to remind you that "hey, stupid, you left the food in the microwave again" would be nice. One second increments between 1-20 seconds would be nice, it jumps in units of five at first, then 10. I can live with it, but you don't have quite the precision of a keypad.

In conclusion, so far, so good. Now the real test is to see how long it lasts. The 37 year old GE sets a pretty high bar to clear...

data.title: Microwave
data.body: My microwave broke at 10 am and Amazon had this Comfee had this one here just before 2 pm on the same day. It was affordable stylish efficient and is easy to manage I like it very much

data.title: Microwave
data.body: Small microwave. Had it for almost a year because our original stopped working. It’s done really well for how inexpensive it is compared to others. You might have to put things in there for an extra 15-20 seconds depending on what you are doing but other then that I’ve had zero issues!!

data.title: Smaller than expected
data.body: My bad for not looking more closely at interior dimensions. I was disappointed to realize that microwave popcorn would not turn inside and just sits in one location. Seems to work well otherwise. Very limited interior space. Also it was a bit odd that there is no push button to open door. Just a handle that you pull on. Not a problem, just different than every other microwave I’ve ever had and takes some getting used to. I still occasionally try to push the button.

data.title: My counter top micro died
data.body: Bought this as a replacement. Didn’t want to spend an arm and a leg. Wish it was a little bigger. I am very limited on counter space so it will do.

data.title: Lovely
data.body: Its beautiful and works great! It takes a little bit more time than Im used to, but it actually heats the center evenly instead of blasting the outside without getting the center. No more molten or frozen hot pocket cores.

data.title: Good value.
data.body: Good value

data.title: Small and affordable
data.body: This microwave is small and affordable! Nice little microwave. It does take a little longer to cook but still gets the job done.

data.title: Why 4 stars
data.body: Recently, my husband and I have became empty-nesters. We no longer need it the huge do everything you do on microwave that took up the whole Counter. Did my research and found this little gem… Great for space great for heating up a plate does everything you need it to for popcorn etc. Drawback Cannot use square plates in this little gem. Big thumbs down for me, because my kids for Christmas brought me a beautiful set of square dishes! The dishes will fit but will not turn.

data.title: Good micro wave but signup to register into COMFEE is not possible
data.body: Microwave does it job, but I learned I can register my product on their website for 3 more warranty months. I upload my file and get the link to register BUT I don't know where the Serial number of my microwave is and I can't even click on the model or brand of the item section because it says "no record of". So it was an impossible task even if I found the SN.

data.title: No button to open door
data.body: This microwave was very similar to the one I had, so I got this one. Didn't realize there was no button to press that opens the door to it, like my old one had. This one has a little handle of sorts that you *pull* to open the door. Whenever we pull it open, the whole microwave moves/slides a little. We have items sitting on top of it...the first few times getting used to having to pull the door open, a few items fell off onto the counter because the microwave moved/slid while trying to open the door. Other than that, it works great.

data.title: Good value!
data.body: Good microwave for the price. Looks good too!

data.title: great smaller microwave.
data.body: I'VE HAD IT FOR A WHILE AND IT WORKS GREAT. i DON'T LIKE HAVING TO OPEN THE DOOR, BUT i CAN LIVE WITH IT. ANOTHER THING IS HAVE TO KEEP A FLASHLIGHT NEXT TO IT TO SEE THE BUTTONS WHICH DON'T STAND OUT AND ARE DARK LIKE THE MICROWAVE. iTS FINE FOR ME AS IT DOESN'T TAKE UP MUCH SPACE IN MY SMALL KITCHEN.

data.title: You can turn off the beeping!
data.body:
I bought this because of the sound off feature, and it does as promised. No tones when buttons are pushed or when cooking is finished. Amazing!
Fits a small space on top of a dorm fridge perfectly, it comes with a turntable, is easy to clean, and the touch to operate buttons are very easy to use.
Cook and reheat times are reasonable, it is 700 watts, not 1100, so expect things to need the longer range on estimated times.
What would make this little microwave perfect? A better door handle- you have to tug this one open, a push button latch might be easier. Also, backlit control panel would be awesome. However, for the price, great purchase. Also, it is light weight- something to consider if you move things around a lot.

data.title: Microwaves
data.body: It was just us bit smaller than I imagined it or what I measure for myself it would be for overall it was all right

data.title: Nice
data.body: Great deal

data.title: Good microwave
data.body: Standard microwave. Does what it needs to do. Nothing came broken or damaged and it works well so 5/5 stars.

data.title: Perfect size

data.title: Does everything I need it to
data.body: My microwave broke and because I rarely use one, I replaced it with this little nugget. It works great on everything I need. It's small though so some things you do have to cook a little longer.

data.title: 700 Watt Comfee Microwave
data.body: Fits perfect for the limited space I have. Inside is a little smaller than some 700 watts I've had in the past, however it does still fit a dinner plate. If popping popcorn, until the bag starts to inflate, it stays stationary on the turning plate as the bags are too long for turning. Once inflated it does rotate. It's best to put a silicone mat underneath as it does slide slightly when opening the door handle. Easy to clean. The few quirks are no big deal. It cooks as it's intended for.

data.title: Easy to use-Priced well
data.body: Easy to use-Priced well. We use microwave for heating food.

data.title: Powerful Heating 🍗🍕🥪🍝
data.body: This microwave is absolutely beautiful. I especially love how it opens. The heating is remarkable and easy to clean 🧽. Thank you so much. Have a bless and safe day.

data.title: Good, Small, Works!
data.body: Needed an inexpensive replacement for a small kitchen and this fit the bill. Our previous microwave's door latch broke, and although it still worked fine, we couldn't use it because we couldn't get the door open! Such a waste. I bought this one because there is no latch. Just pull to open. Has all the features typical of a basic microwave oven - spinning, glass table, one-push 30 sec button, various pre-set buttons, etc.

data.title: Excelente 👌
data.body: Excelente 👌

data.title: Perfect Mini Microwave if you have little space to play with
data.body:
I did not recognize this brand, but decided to take a chance based on the numerous positive reviews out on Amazon. This turned out to be a great purchase for a mini-microwave that does what a big one would. We had limited counter-space and this worked perfectly for our needs of a device that is used only to warm up plates and leftoevers. My initial fear was due to the size it would not fit a "standard" dinner plate, but it does (barely) ! Food gets warmed up quickly and efficiently.

All the basic functions are there, it's quick and easy to start things up. Interface is easy to read and use. It's quiet in operation and it also can be muted so if you want a quiet snack and not wake up the baby or whatever, this is a nice feature I have not seen often on a microwave. There is a turntable on it also, so it will do the same things a bigger microwave would. Look-wise it's modern and attractive.

So if all you are looking for is a small microwave that won't take too much counter space, look no further. This one is a no-brainer.

data.title: I loved it
data.body: I would definitely recommend nice size works amazing I love it

data.title: One touch to start!
data.body: I love the microwave color and features.

data.title: Just right...
data.body: This item was just right for a small space. I don't like a cluttered countertop. I also don't use a microwave to cook meals in. Just to warm things up. I like the ease of use. Press 1-5 and the minutes automatically start. You CAN turn the beep down or off. It is just perfect for what I use it for. Not a loud sound when on. It was a good purchase for me.

data.title: Works fine
data.body: Great product. Works very well. Just what was needed for a small space

data.title: Convenient as needed.
data.body: Basic microwave for daily needs at a reasonable price and in a comfortable size, especially if you don’t have much space or have a narrow kitchen with limited counters tops. If don’t plan to cook a whole turkey on it (lol), it will be just fine.

data.title: 95 year old Mom can use!
data.body: Bought this for my 95 year old Mom… (she lives with me) she is legally blind but can see the numbers. She likes to be independent . Push one button and it comes on. It’s a win win for us. She was always slamming my microwave door and pushing buttons just hoping to find the right one.

data.title: Satisfied customer
data.body: Accurate on timely matter and package was given to me at my door thankyou amazon u guys are 👍 great

data.title: Nice
data.body: Very nice little microwave, save me lots of space. The power is a bit weak, needs to double the heating time. The only problem to me is that it is so small that couldn’t fit in the Costco rotisserie chicken. If its inner space is 2 inches bigger then would be perfect.

data.title: Design flaws
data.body: Biggest design flaw? The manufacturer designed this machine TOO light. So light, that you can't open the door without moving the entire microwave an inch or two. Then ya gotta move it back. And do it again when you open the door in 30 seconds or a minute or two. How ridiculous. Why in god's name would someone design an appliance like this? And why in god's name are 22K people so OK with this? Expect better, peeps.

data.body: Affordable, My grand daughter loves it in her college dorm room.

data.title: Easy to use!

We set up a makeshift kitchen in a spare bedroom and bought this microwave and a couple other small appliances to get us by. this microwave is powerful for size, great for making breakfast, heating up tea or coffee, and can actually handle larger bowls and plates, it’s been a great little microwave for the price.

data.title: Super happy with this purchase! 🙌🏽🙌🏽🙌🏽
data.body: I’m SO happy with this purchase not only it was a good price but also the size, quality and power 💥 it checked off all the boxes for me compare to my old micro that dies and I replace it with this model such a better product than the 1 I’ve purchased at Target! Just the fact the once your timer is up it will only beep once to let you know your food is ready unlike my old model it keeps on beeping until you open the door and close it to stop the annoying beeping just that alone it already better and bonus it does what a micro suppose to do which is to heat up your food fast which this space saver micro delivers 💯 of the time. Super pleased with this purchase 🤩

data.title: Microwave

data.title: Functional and cute

data.title: works
data.body: I got this for my daughter who was going away for college. No complaints as of this point.

data.title: Super cute! Effective!
data.body:
Who's ever heard of Comfee before? I'm used to buying from Black & Decker, Panasonic, Toshiba - you know, the usual suspects. But look at the style of this thing. This is what appliances *should* look like, elevate your space! I had the same hesitations as most looking at this probably do:

(1) I've never heard of this brand before, it's going to melt and light my building on fire
(2) The interface is going to be counter intuitive and impossible to use

To address (1) - the internals of most microwaves are almost identical. I've had zero issues so far. It heats up my food great, and I've noticed no time difference, no dead spots, honestly very little difference compared to other microwaves I've owned/used in the past

To address (2) - yes the interface *is* a little clunky. But honestly a few minutes with the instruction manual and it's not all that bad. The dial is a little tricky when setting cook time - you turn it one direction first, then turn it back to get it down to the right range (you'll see what I mean) - but I'm almost always using the 30 second button anyway. Also it has the mute setting as a dedicated button which is huge!

In terms of size the 0.9 cubic ft SKU fits perfectly in my small kitchen and has plenty of space inside to fit plates and larger tupperware. 0.7 seemed way too small (also in terms of power) so if you have the space for the 0.9 one I'd recommend it!

data.title: Well made
data.body: Excellent value for what you receive. Instructions were clear and easy to use and well made.

data.title: Mother in law
data.body: Mother in law need this. She had no complaints

data.title: Bigger in the inside, and does the job
data.body:
We have very limited counter space in our less-than-functional kitchen (not complaining too much though because I have friends who live in NYC with a sink, stove and 10 inches of what they call counter-space so...). We went without a microwave for a year once our built-in caught fire. Our landlord is, well, a landlord, so they were not going to replace it. So we got real good with slow heating things up on the stove and making the whole house at least 10 degrees higher when we heated things up in the oven. It was fine though. I actually was starting to think more highly of myself since our family was able to live without a microwave. We were two steps away from self-sufficiency and I was contemplating taking a canning class.

Then the pandemic hit. Our college-aged kid was back. She couldn’t make her mac & cheese cups or ramen without a microwave. This meant she was asking me for help with how to boil water and banging pots and pans at 2AM since she’s also a vampire. Apparently. We made it two months into lockdown, with temps here getting higher and the world sort of falling apart. I wanted to be able to eat instantly, since some days I’d forget about doing that or even drinking water. So I had to get a microwave.

I didn’t want to spend a lot (who has money these days?!) and wanted something that wouldn’t take up a ton of space but was functional for us. Reviews for any microwave under $100 are a mess to sift through. But I did, and finally just went with this one. I figured any microwave was better than no microwave.

I don’t have any cons on this one yet. It small (but like the TARDIS, there is plenty of space inside). It’s quiet (but also my kitchen is galley-style, so it might seem loud in a wide open space, I have no idea). It fits our plates (basic ikea dinner plates, because even a few years ago who had money?) & whatever foods meant for microwaves that we have encountered thus far. Food heats evenly. Has quick buttons for common foods. I can heat up leftovers, and the kids can cook for themselves which is a whole other bonus months into us all being under one roof ALL THE TIME.

I like this microwave a lot, and it does what I need it to do. I even bought a cute cover for it because we all need some nice things these days and it is ridiculous to have a microwave cover, which alone makes me smile each time I see it.

data.title: It's a microwave
data.body: More for a first time microwave in a small aparment, but when you need something quick and cheap it does the job. The buttons took a while to get use to compared to the last one, its faster and easier, but I have it in my head to press more buttons than I need to. Ours makes a rattle when it runs and had to prop something under the button panel to make it stop. It's fine and don't hold that against the product and probably more to shipping.

data.title: Microwave
data.body: Works as it should.

data.title: Dad seems to really like it
data.body: I bought this for my 93 year old father when his old one gave up the ghost. I was afraid he wouldn't be able to "figure it out" seeings how it's new and different from the one he was so use to. He loves it which, to me means, it's very simple to use. It is small though so if you need room for larger items in your microwave, this probably wouldn't be the one for you.

data.title: Works ok
data.body: I'm not sure if all small microwaves are not as powerful but this one just doesn't heat up as well as my last microwave did. I have to heat things longer in this one. I also have to tip my plate to the side to put it in because the front is not wide enough which I don't like

data.title: Great machine for small space, right price
data.body: My only issue with this machine is that there is no push-button door latch. The only way I've found to quickly open the door without flinging it across the room is to grip the handle with the fingers of your left hand and push against the panel with your left thumb. It's a bit of a learning curve. Also. it's relatively light and should probably be placed on some sort of non-skid mat.
Perfecto

data.title: Great little Microwave!
data.body: I needed a small white microwave and finding one in my budget was very difficult. I love the way this looked but I was very nervous going with an off brand. I have been using this now for months and it is awesome. Works great mechanically, easy to clean and it is adorable! I wished they made a matching air fryer!

data.title: The menus and buttons are super inconvenient
data.body: We loved the look of the microwave, but after two weeks we couldn’t get past the difficult-to-use interface. In my opinion, the knob SHOULD be used to set the cooking duration, but its default was selecting cooking modes. To set the time, you had to press several buttons first, and the function names displayed on the screen are far from descriptive. We spent far too much time looking back at the manual to see what everything meant.
Perfect small size and loving the mute.

data.body: Updated review: this is a good microwave and I like the vintage look. Not the most powerful Appliance but does the job

data.title: Perfectly basic microwave
data.body: This is a small microwave and so it cooks slower. For every item I used to cook in my larger one, I have to cook them longer in this one. It just took some getting used to. I like my all black small microwave that fits nicely in my small apartment.

data.title: Had to return but super cute and amazing customer service
data.body: I loved the look and easy use of this little microwave, but unfortunately the motor had a problem—it was very loud and sounded like it was on its last legs. When I finally psyched myself up to call customer service, anticipating a long wait and sub-par experience, I was very pleasantly surprised to be immediately connected with a very friendly, professional associate who collected the info, quickly sent me an email detailing what I needed to do to start the return process, and called me within minutes of receiving my response, approving the return. I wish the oven hadn’t had a problem, hence the 4 star rating, but customer service doesn’t get much better than that!

data.title: Does the thing
data.body: It does what a microwave does

data.title: Apricot means cream colored
data.body: I took a chance and hoped that the color in the picture was accurate. It is.

data.title: Color description inaccurate
data.body: Microwave is cute but description says Green, in the photos it looks blue, I took a chance hoping it would be close to my other mint green appliances, nope its blue, if youre color blind you might not notice
